Next, describe the **spatial position of subjects and elements in the video**, if relevant. If **shot size or spatial position** changes, describe how these transitions occur clearly, specifying both the **initial and final states**.

In addition, the human-written captions below already describe the subjects (if any) and the scenery in this video but do not capture their spatial composition and movements. This figure is rendered in a light gray, angular style, but its head and torso are strongly illuminated by a red light, giving them a distinct red appearance, while its arms and hands also show a red tint. In the background, to the right, stand two other figures. The figure closer to the center, with a build and attire resembling a formal suit, stands with arms crossed and appears to be male. The figure further to the right is partially obscured, has a hand on their hip, and is wearing a scarf, suggesting they are female. Both background figures are a uniform light gray or white, with subtle blueish ambient lighting, and are rendered in a low-polygon, angular style. All three figures have featureless, angular faces.**
Human-Written Description for Scenery: **The video depicts a dimly lit indoor scene featuring three low-poly, stylized human figures. In the foreground, a figure with short, stylized hair is seated at a dark desk, with both hands on the keyboard of a computer monitor that has a curved stand, seemingly typing. This central figure is rendered in a desaturated tone but is prominently illuminated by a red glow emitted from the monitor, highlighting its torso and faceless head. Behind this individual, two other figures stand in the darker background; they are rendered in a pale, almost white, desaturated color. One of these background figures has its arms crossed, and both appear to be observing the person at the computer. The overall environment is dark and minimalist, with the red light on the foreground figure being the most striking visual element.**

Please note that the video features **salient human subjects**, so you should focus on describing the spatial framing and movements of them.
